meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>draw</kanji> and the verb vocab refers to creating visual art, like drawings or paintings, making this <vocabulary>to draw</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to paint</vocabulary>. It can also be used figuratively <vocabulary>to illustrate</vocabulary> ideas or dreams, or <vocabulary>to depict</vocabulary> scenes in one's mind.
readingMnemonic: The reading is the same as 書く, which is similar to drawing something (you use a writing instrument on a piece of paper, which you can do with drawing). Another reading is えがく, which is like saying 絵を書く, but combined and rendaku'd.
